pack up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to put things into cases, bags etc ready for a trip somewhere
pack up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Most of the holidaymakers had packed up and gone.
I gave her a hand packing up her clothes and stuff.
pack up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to put something into a box or other container, so that it can be moved, sold, or stored
pack up.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Don’t worry. The removal men will pack everything up.
pack up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to finish work at the end of the day
pack up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: ‘What time do you pack up?’ ‘Oh, about six.’
pack up.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if a machine packs up, it stops working because there is something wrong with it
pack up.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to stop doing something, especially a job
pack up.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: He packed up his teaching job after only three months.
pack up.translation[1].definitions[0].de: if a machine or piece of equipment packs up, it stops working
pack up.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: All the computers packed up, so we couldn’t do any work.
pack up.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The market collapsed and the company packed up and moved into something else.
